distribution.name: Debian 7
distribution.lockcmd: echo -n Waiting for the dpkg lock; while fuser /var/lib/dpkg/lock /var/lib/dpkg/lock-frontend /var/run/unattended-upgrades.lock >/dev/null 2>&1; do echo -n .; sleep 1; done

distribution.name: openSUSE 11.2
distribution.lockcmd: echo -n Waiting for the zypper lock; while zypper needs-rebooting >/dev/null 2>&1; [ $? -eq 7 ]; do echo -n .; sleep 1; done

fix.title: Could not load the D-Bus Python modules
fix.description: Lets the GUI detect CDs and other storage devices.

fix.title: Could not load the D-Bus Python modules
fix.description: Lets the GUI detect CDs and other storage devices.

fix.title: Missing Python 3 GObject introspection support
fix.description: This is needed to display the CrossOver user interface.

fix.title: Missing GTK 3 Python support
fix.description: This is needed to display the CrossOver user interface.

fix.title: Missing Vte 2.91 Python support
fix.description: This is used to integrate command line tools with the CrossOver user interface.

fix.title: Missing GTK 2 Python 2 support
fix.description: On old systems this is needed to display the CrossOver user interface.

fix.title: Missing openssl tool
fix.description: The OpenSSL tool is needed to verify the integrity of the downloaded files, most notably the CrossTies.

fix.title: Missing Debian packaging tools
fix.description: This prevents turning bottles into Debian packages.

fix.title: Missing RPM packaging tools
fix.description: This prevents turning bottles into RPM packages.

fix.title: Bad virtual memory limit
fix.description: Your system limits the amount of virtual memory an application can use (see ulimit -Hv). This is likely to prevent Windows applications from working.
Without this library Windows applications cannot run.
Without this library no Windows application will work.
This library is needed for network and Internet access. Installing it is strongly recommended.
Without this library no Windows application will work.
Without this library no Windows application will work.
Without this library neither CrossOver nor Windows applications will work.
Without this library neither CrossOver nor Windows applications will work.
This library is used to display Windows applications.
This library is used to display Windows applications.
This library is used to display the text in Windows applications.
On Unix systems this is needed to extract the desktop menu icons. It is also needed by some applications that use PNG images in their user interface in which case its lack results in black icons.

fix.title: pthread_cancel() does not work
fix.description: Without a working pthread_cancel() implementation most Windows applications will not work.

fix.title: Cannot create 16-bit LDT segments
fix.description: Your system prevents the creation of 16-bit LDT segments. This will prevent many Windows applications from working.

fix.title: There are no DRI drivers
fix.description: It looks like the DRI drivers are not installed which may be why OpenGL looks like it is broken.
This is an alternative to PulseAudio for providing sound to Windows applications.
When running PulseAudio, libasound is required for MIDI devices and playback.
Provides support for some ISDN cards. Very few applications need this.
Needed for NTLM authentication.
Needed to print to printers managed by the CUPS system, which is most likely the case. It is strongly recommended for office-type applications.
This is needed for Windows applications to automatically detect CD-ROM and USB key insertion.
Makes it possible to find and use the system's TrueType fonts. This is strongly recommended for office-type applications.
Provides hardware-accelerated Direct3D and OpenGL support. This is used for games, but also for CAD applications.
This may be needed by some games or CAD applications.
This library is needed by applications that perform encryption or check online certificates.
Lets Windows applications access digital cameras.
Lets Windows applications access digital cameras.
Lets Windows applications use the GSM codec for audio compression and decompression.
This is needed by some games and multimedia applications.
This is needed by some games and multimedia applications.
GStreamer is needed by some games and multimedia applications, including PowerPoint, to play audio and/or video content.
These GStreamer plugins may be needed by some games and multimedia applications to play audio and/or video content.
These GStreamer plugins may be needed by some games and multimedia applications to play audio and/or video content.
These GStreamer plugins may be needed by some games and multimedia applications to play audio and/or video content.
These GStreamer plugins may be needed by some games and multimedia applications to play audio and/or video content.

fix.title: Missing 32-bit gst-plugins-ugly (mpg123audiodec) GStreamer plugin
fix.description: This GStreamer plugin may be needed by some games and multimedia applications to play audio and/or video content.

fix.title: Missing 32-bit gst-plugins-libav GStreamer plugin
fix.description: This GStreamer plugin may be needed by some games and multimedia applications to play audio and/or video content.
This may be needed for Windows applications to automatically detect CD-ROM and USB key insertion.
Lets Windows applications use Kerberos authentication.
Provides color profile information to Windows applications. This is particularly useful if you have color-calibrated your screen but some applications need it even if you have not done so.
Lets Windows applications access LDAP servers.
Needed by some Windows applications to play MP3 files.
Needed by some console Windows applications.
Needed for NTLM authentication.
Lets Windows applications use the Open Database Connectivity API (ODBC) to access databases.
Provides audio support to Windows applications.
Provides GPU computation support to Windows applications.
This is needed by some games and CAD-like applications to perform off-screen rendering.
This is needed by some games and CAD-like applications to perform off-screen rendering.
This provides low-level network access to Windows applications.
This is the preferred way to provide audio support to Windows applications.
This is needed by some network Windows applications to perform DNS queries.
Lets Windows applications access scanners.
This library provides support for secure Internet communication.
This library is needed to unpack installers in the .7z format.
This is needed by some applications that need to manipulate TIFF images in their user interface.
This is needed by some applications that need to manipulate TIFF images in their user interface.
Lets Windows applications detect when devices are plugged in.
This is needed to run 64-bit applications.
Gives Windows applications direct access to USB devices.
Lets Windows applications access video devices.
Lets Windows applications access video devices.
This library is needed for games which use the Vulkan graphics API; for D3D12 applications; and for the DXVK layer for D3D11.
This is needed for most CAD-like applications and some games.
Lets Windows applications use color mouse pointers. This is mostly useful for some games.
This provides better copy/paste support from X to Windows applications.
This library provides support for joysticks and tablets. If you don't have such a device you don't need it.
This is needed if your display spans multiple screens. If your computer has a single screen then you don't need it.
This library makes it possible for Windows applications to read and write XML files.
This is needed to let games adjust the display resolution as needed. It is strongly recommended to install it if you plan to use games.
Windows applications can work without this library, but its absence is likely to cause display artifacts.
This library lets Windows applications perform queries and transformations on XML files.
This is needed to let games perform some gamma adjustments (essentially to adjust the brightness).
This is needed by most Windows applications accessing the Internet.

fix.title: Alsa does not go through PulseAudio
fix.description: PulseAudio is being used but Alsa does not interface with it. Applications using MIDI playback may have sound problems.

fix.title: The OpenGL capabilities are insufficient for Direct3D 10 support
fix.description: This is required for Microsoft Office 2016 support.

fix.title: OpenGL is not using Direct Rendering
fix.description: This typically indicates a graphics driver configuration issue and will prevent most 3D games and applications from working correctly.

fix.title: OpenGL shading language version is older than 1.30
fix.description: This is needed for DirectX 10 support.

fix.title: OpenGL has no S3TC texture support
fix.description: This is needed to run games using textures in the S3TC format.

fix.title: OpenGL has no floating point texture support
fix.description: This is needed to run games using floating point textures.

fix.title: OpenGL does not work
fix.description: OpenGL did not work in our simple tests. This means OpenGL and DirectX applications, including most games, will likely not work. Other applications should be unaffected.

fix.title: Outdated AMD OpenGL Driver
fix.description: Your proprietary AMD/ATI OpenGL driver is outdated. This could cause games to freeze or draw incorrectly. You may ignore this issue for non-3D applications.

fix.title: Outdated NVIDIA OpenGL Driver
fix.description: Your proprietary NVIDIA OpenGL driver is outdated. This could cause games to freeze or draw incorrectly. You may ignore this issue for non-3D applications.

fix.title: Low X11 Screen Depth
fix.description: The screen depth is lower than 24bpp. This may cause display artifacts in some applications.

fix.title: X11 does not work
fix.description: X11 did not work in our simple tests. This means neither CrossOver nor Windows applications will work.
